Posted By: Hylebos (9/25/2012 5:54:16 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Far and away my favorite card of the set (gee, can you tell I'm mostly EDH?)  
The extra value this gives to lands like [Diamond Valley](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Diamond Valley) or [Boseiju, Who Shelters All](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Boseiju, Who Shelters All) is totally worth the 3-   
The extra mana rock is really just icing.  
  
My only regret is that this, unlike my beloved [Darksteel Ingot](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Darksteel Ingot),  
will inevitably become the victim of Spot Removal.  
  
Also, this is way more useful than Ingot in monocolored decks.  
This gem isn't just for 5 color decks, guys ;)

Posted By: Lord_Ascapelion (12/4/2012 11:31:51 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: This card is really extraordinary. It can ramp any color deck to 5 mana on turn four, letting you spring all kinds of great cards a turn early, like [Wolfir Silverheart](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Wolfir Silverheart), [Thragtusk](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Thragtusk), [Thundermaw Hellkite](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Thundermaw Hellkite), [Tamiyo, the Moon Sage](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Tamiyo, the Moon Sage), [Curse of Death's Hold](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Curse of Death's Hold), [Vorapede](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Vorapede), etc. For a non-green card to allow you to get out a Thundermaw or a Tamiyo or a Curse of Death's hold a turn early is awesome. Of course it also fixes your mana colors, so you could actually play such 3UU, 3BB, and 3RR spells in the same deck and have a good chance of casting whichever one you need. This card could actually make grixis control competitive again. And to top it off, it actually synergizes very well with cards like [Evolving Wilds](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Evolving Wilds) and [Desolate Lighthouse](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Desolate Lighthouse), because they can now provide colored mana. This really boosts Evolving wilds in particular becau... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)

Of course it also fixes your mana colors, so you could actually play such 3UU, 3BB, and 3RR spells in the same deck and have a good chance of casting whichever one you need. posts.post_content: I think its safe to say that this Standard season is the greatest ever seen in terms of mana fixing. Don't think so? Ravnica Shocklands, M10 Duals, Innistrad Duals, and this gorgeous piece of cardboard here. Honestly, the only way to make it better would be for Wizards to say "Hey, what were we thinking? Just play what you want, forget about colours."

posts.post_content:
@vakyoom; I'm sure people will flame me for this, but how is this not balanced? It's powerful yes, but I have to disagree with all of your "arguments". Especially those about RtR (but thats for another time). I'm not a huge fan of a lot of it myself, but that's mostly because I don't really care for the guilds or their "abilities".   
  
Legendary? if it was 1 or 2 cmc less.  
CIP Tapped? if it was 1 or 2 cmc less  
4 CMC? If it was an uncommon or even common.  
  
You have a right to you opinion, which I'm sure the majority shares, but this is just mine. Then again I like to turn 1 or 2 Jin-Gitaxias/Iona so maybe I just like broken things =)  
   
Note: My only problem with Cavern of Souls is I don't have any; and at $25 I probably never will. Unless they drop in price substantially when it cycles out of standard.
